intro: Nephrodium tetragonum, commonly known as the four-cornered kidney fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive fronds with a quadrilateral shape. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided and can grow up to several centimeters in length. Nephrodium tetragonum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices.
